meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the foetal development of the baby during the ultrasound.
meanings.sent2: The foetal heartbeat could be heard clearly through the monitor.
meanings.sent3: The foetal movements in the womb looked like a tiny dance party.
meanings.sent4: The foetal growth of the seedling was a promising sign for the garden.
meanings.sent5: The foetal position of the puppy made it look extra adorable.

meanings.definition: In the early stages of development.
meanings.sent1: The project was still in its foetal phase, with many details to be worked out.
meanings.sent2: The foetal version of the software lacked key features present in the final product.
meanings.sent3: The foetal idea for the new invention seemed far-fetched at first.
meanings.sent4: The foetal stages of the relationship were filled with excitement and uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The foetal buds on the tree branches hinted at the beauty of spring to come.
